org.assertj.swing.fixture
Class AbstractWindowFixture<S,C extends Window,D extends WindowDriver>

java.lang.Object
  org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,C,D>
      org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractContainerFixture<S,C,D>
          org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractWindowFixture<S,C,D>
Type Parameters:
S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
C - the type of Container that this fixture can manage.
D - the type of ComponentDriver that this fixture uses internally.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentContainerFixture, JPopupMenuInvokerFixture, MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>, WindowLikeContainerFixture<S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DialogFixture, FrameFixture
public abstract class AbstractWindowFixture<S,C extends Window,D extends WindowDriver>
extends AbstractContainerFixture<S,C,D>
implements WindowLikeContainerFixture<S>, JPopupMenuInvokerFixture

Supports functional testing of Window.

Author:
Alex Ruiz

Constructor Detail

AbstractWindowFixture

public AbstractWindowFixture(@Nonnull
                             Class<S> selfType,
                             @Nonnull
                             Class<? extends C> type)
Creates a new AbstractWindowFixture. This constructor creates a new Robot containing the current AWT hierarchy.

Parameters:
selfType - the "self type."
type - the type of Window to find using the created Robot.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the given Window type is null.
ComponentLookupException - if a Window having a matching type could not be found.
ComponentLookupException - if more than one Window having a matching type is found.
See Also:
BasicRobot.robotWithCurrentAwtHierarchy()
